text: Hi everyone, is it correct that i have to have the columns prepared before importing content into that table? if there are a lot of columns this can be a tideous task. i would expect there to be an option where i can just import a whole table, without creating the columns first.

Are there any examples anywhere of how to use a module text field to filter a HubDB table? For example, have a whole table of information and at the page level you can simply type in the name of what you want to show and that single row will be pulled through?
Right now, importing does not support that. You may use CLI to achieve that
I don't have an example but it should be simple `hubdb_table_rows` function call with the query right?
Hi everyone I need help storing unique values for a HubDB column into an array and getting the length of that array
can u use `sort`  and `unique` hubL filters if the list of values for a column?
